alert.note: Alert for Pike (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 08 at 8:20PM EDT until September 08 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL SULLIVAN AND NORTHEASTERN PIKE COUNTIES... At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that the heavy rain has ended across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Runoff from this heavy rain will cause flash flooding. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Shohola, Highland Lake, Eldred, Glen Spey, Greeley, Barryville and Twin Lakes. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
